title.value: Electric Power Fuse Identification with Deep Learning
title.justification: The title clearly states the focus of the paper which is on identifying electric power fuses using deep learning techniques.
title.quote: Electric Power Fuse Identification with Deep Learning

extractions.description: This paper presents a method to identify fuse types in electrical installations using deep learning models, improving safety by allowing photos from a distance without clear labels.

type.justification: The paper involves experiments with a deep learning model and dataset creation to achieve precise identification of fuse types.
type.quote: Multiple experiments were performed to train a final model, reaching an average precision (AP 50 ) of 91.06 % on the holdout set, which confirms its potential for identification of fuse types in new photos.

name.justification: The primary research field is Electrical Engineering, as the paper pertains to identifying electrical fuses using deep learning, a task related to electrical systems and safety.
name.quote: The development of new techniques to help accelerate the work of fuse identification when conducting arc flash studies has a great application potential in the industry of electrical power system studies.

name.justification: The paper uses computer vision techniques to identify fuses based on physical characteristics like shape and color.
name.quote: To automate this process using deep learning techniques, a new dataset of fuse pictures was created.

name.justification: Deep learning techniques are employed to automate the task of fuse identification.
name.quote: In this paper, our objective is to show that object detection neural network models can be applied to this task.

name.justification: The study focuses specifically on object detection as it aims to identify and classify fuses in images.
name.quote: Object detection corresponds to the task of identifying the class and location of objects that can be found within images.

name.justification: Faster R-CNN was chosen for its superior performance in the fuse identification task in the experiments.
name.quote: Since the hyperparameters choices were made on the best validation split performance, the Faster R-CNN architecture was selected for the subsequent experiment phases.

is_contributed.justification: Faster R-CNN is an established model that was used in the study, not contributed by the authors.

is_executed.justification: The paper describes utilizing Faster R-CNN for object detection tasks.
is_executed.quote: The Faster R-CNN architecture performed better on the validation split.

is_compared.justification: Faster R-CNN was one of several models compared in the study based on performance.
is_compared.quote: From the results shown in Fig. 3, we chose the model at the best epoch based on the highest validation AP.

referenced_paper_title.value: Faster R-CNN: Towards Real-Time Object Detection with Region Proposal Networks
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper is known for introducing Faster R-CNN, which is relevant to the paper's methods.

name.justification: The paper specifically mentions creating and using the 'Survey Dataset' for training the model.
name.quote: A total of 6,039 survey images were gathered from past arc flash projects to create the 'Survey Dataset'.

referenced_paper_title.justification: This dataset was created for the purpose of this research and isn't from another paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: This dataset contains some pictures in which fuses are difficult to identify due to poor quality.

name.justification: The Google Images Dataset was used as an additional training data source for the model.
name.quote: In this study, another dataset was also created by gathering 1,116 pictures of the 10 selected classes from the Google Images search engine (the 'Google Images Dataset').

referenced_paper_title.justification: The dataset was formed by collecting images using a search engine, not sourced from an existing research paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The ‘Learning Set’ and the ‘Google Images Dataset’ were combined to create the ‘Augmented Learning Set’.

name.justification: PyTorch was used in the development and application of the deep learning models in this study.
name.quote: The pipelines were developed in Python with the PyTorch deep learning framework.

referenced_paper_title.justification: PyTorch is a widely used library and not contributed by a specific paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: The pipelines were developed in Python with the PyTorch deep learning framework.
